src:
Djokovic Juara Paris Masters 2019
04 Nov 2019, 00:47 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Novak Djokovic juara Paris Masters 2019. (MARTIN BUREAU / AFP)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Petenis Novak Djokovic berhasil menjuaraiÂ Paris Masters 2019 usai menaklukkan Denis Shapovalov dari Kanada di partai final, Minggu (3/11).Djokovic yang berstatus unggulan pertama, mampu mengalahkan petenis 20 tahun dengan skor 6-3, 6-4. Ini menjadi gelar kelima Djokovic di Paris Masters.Di final Masters ke-50 tersebut, Djokovic sempat memimpin 3-0 atas Shapovalov dan memenangkan set pertama dalam tempo 29 menit. Ia juga mampu memanfaatkan satu-satunya break point untuk memastikan kemenangan atas Shapovalov.Petenis berusia 32 tahun itu tercatat sudah menjuarai 34 Masters dan hanya berjarak satu gelar di bawah Rafael Nadal yang memuncaki daftar juara terbanyak.Paris Masters merupakan trofi kelima Djokovic musim ini setelah menjuarai Wimbledon, Australia Open, Madrid Open, dan Tokyo Open.Djokovic akan kehilangan gelar nomor satu dunia dari Nadal pekan depan. Namun, Nadal diragukan tampil fit pada ATP Tour Final yang dimulai pada 10 November di London karena cedera otot.Sementara Djokovic sudah lima kali memenangi kejuaraan penutup musim itu dan berpeluang merebut kembali gelar petenis nomor satu dunia.
text:
Djokovic Champion of the 2019 Paris Masters
Nov 04 2019, 00:47 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Novak Djokovic won the 2019 Paris Masters. (MARTIN BUREAU / AFP)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Tennis player Novak Djokovic won the Paris Masters 2019 after conquering Denis Shapovalov of Canada in the final, Sunday (11/3). The first-seeded Djokovic won the 20-year tennis player 6-3, 6- 4 This became Djokovic's fifth title at the Paris Masters. In the final of the 50th Masters, Djokovic had a 3-0 lead over Shapovalov and won the first set within 29 minutes. He is also able to use the only break point to ensure victory over Shapovalov. The 32-year-old player has recorded 34 Masters and is only one title below Rafael Nadal who topped the list of most champions. Paris Masters is Djokovic's fifth trophy this season after winning Wimbledon, Australian Open, Madrid Open and Tokyo Open. Djokovic will lose the world number one title from Nadal next week. However, Nadal is doubtful of appearing fit at the ATP Tour Final, which began on November 10 in London due to a muscle injury.
